question: A 70-year-old male patient presents to the clinic with complaints of feeling something sticking in his throat, difficulty in swallowing, and weight loss. He also gives a history of regurgitating undigested food 4 to 5 hours after consumption. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A young woman comes to the clinic with the complaint of intermittent episodes of vertigo on turning her head to the left. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 20-year-old male reports to the clinic after a flight with complaints of bilateral severe earache, deafness, and tinnitus. Otoscopy reveals bubbles in the middle ear across a retracted eardrum. What is the most likely diagnosis?

Noise is an undesirable and unwanted vibration of sound that can cause damage to humans both physically and mentally. The intensity of sound is measured in decibels (dB). Which of the following is the daily acceptable limit of noise that the human ear can tolerate without any substantial damage to hearing?
A mother brings in her 4-year-old boy to the clinic with complaints of severe right-sided earache, high-grade fever, and mild hearing impairment. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 17-year-old male presents to the emergency department with the complaint of bleeding from the nose after suffering a trauma. Which of the following is the most common site of epistaxis?

A 21-year-old female presents to the otorhinolaryngology outpatient department with the complaint of painless and progressive hearing loss. Her hearing is better in noisy surroundings. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 75-year-old lady comes to the clinic with the complaint of decreased hearing bilaterally. Her blood pressure is 145/98 mmHg and her ear examination is unremarkable. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 4-year-old girl is brought into the clinic by her mother with the complaint of bilateral hearing loss for the last 6 months. She has also been snoring at night. Otoscopy reveals fluid level with air bubbles in both ears along with dull, bluish, and retracted tympanic membranes. What is the most likely diagnosis of this patient?

answers.option: Safe type chronic suppurative otitis media

question: An 18-year-old male presents to the clinic with a diffuse swelling in the submandibular region, fever, ptyalism, and difficulty in chewing. He also gives a history of toothache. On examination, the swelling is diffuse, firm, and brawny with raised floor of the mouth. What is the most likely diagnosis?

Tuning fork tests were conducted on a 26-year-old woman. Rinne's test revealed that bone conduction was greater than air conduction in both of her ears. Weber's test was centralized and Schwabach's test was equal to that of the examiner in both ears. Which of the following is the most likely explanation for these findings?

A 24-year-old male visits the clinic with a complaint of a swelling in the floor of the oral cavity that ruptures and reappears on and off for the last 2 years. Oral examination reveals a transparent globular cystic swelling in the floor of the mouth. What is the most likely clinical diagnosis?

A 28-year-old female visits the outpatient department with complaints of restricted mouth opening, burning of the mouth, and intolerance to spicy food. She is habitual of chewing betel nuts for the last 12 years. Which premalignant condition is most likely to be present in this patient?

A 34-year-old patient presents to the outpatient clinic with complaints of sudden onset vertigo, tinnitus, and fluctuating hearing loss. This attack was preceded by a sensation of fullness in the affected ear. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 45-year-old malnourished lady is having difficulty swallowing for the past 6 months. Oral cavity examination revealed smooth tongue and fissures at both angles of the mouth. Which of these diagnostic tests are required in this patient?
A 7-year-old child has undergone a tonsillectomy. Just after a few hours of surgery in the ward. He develops bleeding from the operative site. What is the type of hemorrhage?
A patient came with complaints of dyspnea in the emergency room. The doctor planned a high tracheostomy for his management. Which of the following is the indication of high tracheostomy?
What is the most common congenital neck cyst?
Which one of the following became the first international research trial on ethics that involves human subjects?
Which of the following is the first complete historic documentation regarding the ethical practice of a medical doctor?

The professor of Medicine was reviewing the proformas constructed by the resident trainee. The proforma contained a consent form, patients’ socio-demographics such as name, age, gender, address, and clinical details on the severity of disease, antibiotics used, and the clinical outcome of the patient. The professor is also the principal investigator of this research titled “Effectiveness of antibiotics in the treatment of gastrointestinal infections”. In the given scenario, which research ethics principle is at risk of violation?

A researcher assessed the effect of blood glucose levels on the running capacity of students in a marathon race. He made two groups and provided sugar-sweetened beverages to group A and nothing was provided to group B. The researcher measured and compared the running speed of the participants in group A and group B. What could be the most appropriate statistical test in this scenario?

A senior obstetrician claims that the mean hemoglobin level of pregnant women of Karachi is not more than 11.5 g/dl. To test this claim, a community survey is conducted. What could be the most appropriate statistical test for this purpose?

A group of final year medical students is collecting online data from adolescents about their pubertal and sexual issues. They intend to use a self-administered questionnaire, which also contains an inventory to assess anxiety and depression in the same sample. Before proceeding with this research study, whom must they obtain permission from?

A pus swab for culture and sensitivity is sent for a 28-year-old man who is suffering from atticoantral type of chronic suppurative otitis media (CSOM). What is the most common organism causing this disease?
A 20-year-old female presents to the outpatient clinic with complaints of pain, redness, and swelling in her right ear for 5 days. She had her ears pierced a week ago. What is the likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is the best investigation for Wegener granulomatosis?
Which of the following is a suitable description of ethics?

A professor is conducting research on a specific antibiotic. He asks a student to provide information about the patients treated with that specific antibiotic. The information included the name, age, ethnicity, and address of the patients. Which ethical principle will be violated if the student provides the information?

A 35-year-old female presents with profuse bleeding from the nose and mouth. Anterior nasal packing is done to stop the bleeding but it does not stop the bleeding. What is the next best step in the management of this patient?

answers.option: Endoscopic ligation of external carotid artery
Posterior nasal packing with anterior packing

question: A 35-year-old factory worker in Karachi, on his general check-up, is worried about noise-induced hearing loss. The physician advises him to limit his daily exposure to noise. According to local guidelines, what is the maximum limit of daily noise exposure which people can tolerate without significant damage to their hearing?
A 3-month-old child presents to the clinic with stridor which is aggravated by crying but gets better on lying prone. What is the most appropriate diagnosis?
What is the investigation of choice for suspected nasopharyngeal angiofibroma?

answers.option: Computed tomography (CT) scan of the head with contrast
Computed tomography (CT) scan of the base of the skull

question: A 45-year-old male patient presented to the ENT outpatient department with a history of clear fluid coming from the nose. The discharge is continuous, can not be sniffed back and there is a history of head injury 2 weeks back. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?

A boy is suffering from acute otitis media. The tympanic membrane is bulging and his symptoms are not improving despite adequate medical treatment. Which of the following is the most appropriate treatment option?

A 4-year-old patient underwent esophagoscopy for obstructed meal bolus and 6 hours after surgery the patient developed severe pain in the interscapular region. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?

A 3-year-old child presents to the emergency department with a complaint of high-grade fever, dyspnea, and lethargy. The condition is somewhat relieved by sitting position with bending forward. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?

A 40-year-old factory worker presents with a complaint of progressive loss of hearing in both ears for the last three years. His pure tone audiometry is done which reveals sensorineural hearing loss in both ears with a dip in air and bone conduction at 4K. This type of graph is typically seen in which of the following conditions?

A 58-year-old man with a known comorbidity of diabetes mellitus for the past 10 years presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of developing sudden pain in the right ear with a fever. On examination, there is severe inflammation with small red swelling in the external auditory canal. The tympanic membrane is intact. The patient is most likely suffering from which condition?

answers.option: Squamous cell carcinoma of the ear

question: When there is a need for an emergency airway opening, the cricothyroid membrane should be immediately pierced. Where exactly is the cricothyroid membrane located?
An 8-year-old boy was diagnosed as a case of Bezold abscess. What is the location of pus in this case?

A 23-year-old male patient is diagnosed with a case of otitis media with effusion which is not responding to the medical treatment. Which of the following surgical procedures is required in this case?
A 30-year-old lady who had otosclerosis in both ears got pregnant. What will be the effect of pregnancy on her ear symptoms?

An 18-year-old male patient presents to the emergency department after being slapped by someone on his left ear. On examination, he has perforation in his left ear. Which type of perforation do you expect in this case?

answers.option: Central perforation with irregular margins and tiny clots

question: A 30-year-old female patient came to the clinic after some insect had gone into her right ear, half an hour back. What solution is used to kill or make an insect unconscious before its removal?
A 7-year-old boy presents with a complaint of bilateral deafness. After evaluation, he is diagnosed with a case of enlarged adenoids. What is the typical type of deafness seen in this patient?
Which of the following conditions is often associated with snoring?

A 20-year-old male patient underwent tonsillectomy. One week later, the patient presented with bleeding from the mouth with hematemesis. What is the most common cause of secondary hemorrhage after tonsillectomy?

A 6-year-old boy came with his mother to the outpatient department with a complaint of nasal obstruction, nasal discharge with bedwetting at night. On examination, the boy had an open mouth and, a pinched nose with prominent incisors. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?

A 35-year-old male presented to the outpatient department with a complaint of a combination of fluctuating sensorineural hearing loss, roaring tinnitus, episodic vertigo, and fullness of the ear. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?

A 23-year-old male comes to the outpatient department with a complaint of nasal obstruction and pain in the nose. On examination, he has bilateral septal swelling which is very tender to touch. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?
A 28-year-old male patient was diagnosed with a case of nasopharyngeal carcinoma (stage III). What is the best treatment option for this patient?
A 67-year-old female patient has been diagnosed with a case of malignant otitis externa. What is the common causative microorganism involved in this pathology?

A 16-year-old boy presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of severe earache with bleeding from the ear. On otoscopy, the tympanic membrane has hemorrhagic bullae. He also has a history of upper respiratory infection. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 25-year-old healthy female patient presents to the ENT outpatient department with a complaint of progressively increasing midline swelling of the neck for 1 year. On examination, it moves on to swallowing. What is the most suitable non-invasive radiological investigation for the diagnosis of this patient?
In a patient with acute otitis media, which of the following best describes the primary pathophysiological mechanism leading to the development of middle ear inflammation and effusion?

answers.option: Allergic reaction in the middle ear

question: An industrialist asks for advice from a public health specialist about the best measures he can take to control noise in the generator factory that he is going to set up. The public health specialist recommends noise control measures at the workplace. Which of the following is the highest measure for control of hazards at the workplace according to the hierarchy of controls?

A 30-year-old male patient who had a history of left ear discharge for the past 5 years, now reported to the ENT clinic with the complaint of severe persistent headache, fever, and vomiting. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A 24-year-old female presents to the clinic with a history of dysphagia to solids for the past 2 years. Her hemoglobin is 7.6 mg/dl. What will be the most likely finding on a barium swallow?

A 13-year-old boy presents to the outpatient department with a history of profuse bleeding from his nose on and off, right-sided nasal blockage, and right-sided hearing impairment for the last 8 months. On anterior rhinoscopic examination, a pinkish mass is seen in the right nostril. What is the most probable diagnosis?
An 18-year-old female patient presents with a boil in the nose. What is the best method for examination of the nasal vestibule in this patient?

answers.option: By elevating tip of the nose with thumb
By asking the patient to lower her head

question: While performing a clinical examination of the nose in a 22-year-old female patient, palpation of the paranasal sinuses is done. Which of the following structures is not possible to palpate?
A 35-year-old lady developed septal adhesion after septal surgery 6 months back. What measures should have been taken at that time to prevent such complications?
Proof puncture or antral washout was planned in a 25-year-old male patient. Which of the following structures is drained in this operation?

A father brought his 5-year-old son with the complaint of rapidly progressing respiratory distress, stridor, dysphagia, and high-grade fever for the last day. Which of the following radiological investigations would be the most helpful for diagnosis?
A lobectomy was planned for a 35-year-old woman who presented with a solitary thyroid nodule in the right lobe. Which of the following structures is at the most risk of damage during surgery?
A 38-year-old male patient was diagnosed with a case of salivary calculus. What is the most common site for calculus formation?

answers.option: Superficial lobe of parotid gland and its duct

question: A 50-year-old male was diagnosed with a malignant tumor of the oral cavity. Which of the following is the most common malignant tumor of the oral cavity?
During a careful examination of a patient's ear, a physician identifies a distinct bulge on the medial wall of the middle ear. This elevation results from which of the underlying structures?

A 32-year-old patient presented to the outpatient department with a complaint of hearing loss and facial weakness on the left side. Imaging studies revealed a lesion in the internal acoustic meatus. Which of the following cranial nerves is commonly found in the internal acoustic meatus?

A patient presented to the outpatient department with a complaint of hearing loss and difficulty in distinguishing between different pitches of sound. During an audiometric evaluation, the audiologist identified a dysfunction related to the organ responsible for hearing, present on the basilar membrane. What is the name of this organ?

A 45-year-old traffic policeman visited a family physician and complained of traffic noise during his duty at Shahreh-e-Faisal. He further explained that he applied for a transfer to an office job but his application was denied. He sought advice from the physician on how to avoid this annoyance. Which one of the following options is the most appropriate and practical advice that the doctor must give to the traffic warden?

answers.option: Plant a barrier from the traffic

question: A student selected a group of poor patients from Civil Hospital, Karachi. He intended to generalize the results of his study on the population of the Karachi city. Which of the following biases will distort the results of his research study?

A group of students intended to control the unwanted effects of an extraneous factor in their observational study design. Which of the following methods will help them to control this extraneous factor?
A researcher wants to provide everybody a chance to be included in the research study. What is the best method to select participants?

A 3-year-old child presents in the outpatient department with complaints of nasal obstruction, snoring, and prominent upper teeth. A differential diagnosis of adenoids is established. What is the best investigation for this case?

answers.option: Ct scan nose and paranasal sinuses
X-ray nasopharynx soft tissue lateral view

question: Which of the following is the most common causative organism for acute tonsillitis?
A patient presented to the clinic with a swelling in the floor of the mouth that causes the tongue to lift up. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A lady presented to the clinic with complaints of dysphagia and hoarseness of voice. On examination, there is ulceration on the vocal cords giving a mouse-nibbled appearance. What is the likely diagnosis?

A patient with known history of diabetes presented to the clinic with the complaint of foul-smelling discharge from the nose. Crusting and black mass was seen on examination. What would be the most probable diagnosis?

A female presented to the clinic with complaints of nasal discharge, nasal blockage, and diplopia. She has a prior history of renal transplantation and has been known to be diabetic for the past 10 years. What is the most probable cause of her symptoms?

A young woman presented to the clinic with the complaint of foul-smelling nasal discharge with nasal blockage. Septal perforation, crusting, and collapse of the nasal bridge were observed on examination. What is the most probable cause of this condition?
A patient presented to the clinic with the complaints of hearing loss. On examination, white mass was seen behind an intact tympanic membrane. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Carhart's notch in bone conduction is seen at what frequency in otosclerosis?

A patient presented with the complaint of severe burning sensation in mouth. On examination, multiple small ulcers with central necrosis and raised red periphery are seen. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A student presented to the clinic with the complaint of discharge from the ear, along with fever and pain which is aggravated by the opening of the jaw. He used to be an active swimmer until a few weeks back. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A patient presented with swelling in the neck which increases in size on blowing the nose. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is used in the treatment of aphthous ulcers?
Which test is related to vertigo due to an otologic cause?
A patient has been experiencing a constant change in voice for three months following a total thyroidectomy, with no reported dyspnea. What might be the likely cause?

A woman presented to the clinic with erythematous lesions on her tongue surrounded by an irregular, white keratotic border persisting for three years. She has no history of addiction. What would be the most appropriate management for this patient?
A patient presented with a hoarse voice after thyroidectomy. Injury to which nerve is responsible for the symptom?

answers.option: Internal branch of superior laryngeal nerve
External branch of superior laryngeal nerve

question: What is the most common site of thyroglossal duct cyst?
A girl presented to the outpatient department with a firm nodular mass on her ear six months after getting her ears pierced. What is the most probable cause?

A 3-year-old boy was brought to the outpatient department by his mother with a complaint of a barking seal-like cough for 2 days. He also had a fever of 45°C and hoarseness. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A female presents to the clinic with hearing loss. Pure tone audiometry reveals conductive hearing loss. The tympanic membrane is normal, and a type As graph is observed on impedance audiometry. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A woodworker came to the clinic with a complaint of blood-stained nasal discharge. An ulcerated mass was seen in the examination. What is the most appropriate investigation for this patient?
A woman comes to the clinic with increased blood pressure, sweating and weight loss. A lump is present on the neck. Bruit can be heard on examination. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the most common site for epistaxis?
A patient presents to the clinic with bleeding in the posterior portion of the inferior turbinate. What is the most common site for posterior epistaxis?

Residents of Burns road are complaining about noise pollution from traffic. With limited resources for construction and limited space available, what is the best cost-effective method that doesn't require sophisticated engineering techniques?
A diabetic woman who has been experiencing ear discharge for a week, followed by ear pain for two days, has now developed facial weakness. What is the most probable diagnosis?
What course of action would you propose for an individual with hard, impacted ear wax?

answers.option: Soda glycerin ear drops and followup in 1 week
Remove ear wax and visualise ear drum
Soda glycerin ear drops and suction next day

question: A 55-year-old female presents with a thyroid nodule on the right side measuring 3X4 cm. Laboratory examinations suggest normal thyroid function, but calcitonin levels are seen to be elevated. What is most appropriate treatment for this patient?
During antral lavage, the direction of the trocar is towards what structure?

answers.option: Superior oblique direction towards maxillary sinus
Medial direction towards the nasal septum

question: A coal worker comes to the outpatient department with yellow crusts in both nasal cavities, he was diagnosed with atrophic rhinitis. What is the most preferable management for this patient?
A patient presents to the clinic with complaints of dyspnea and high-grade fever. Lateral soft tissue X-ray of the neck shows a thumb sign. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
A patient presents with an irregular mass in the parotid gland. Biopsy shows pleomorphic adenoma. What would be the most appropriate treatment for this patient?
A boy presents to the clinic with high-grade fever and bilateral facial swelling anterior to the preauricular region. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What would be the next step in the management of a patient who had a biopsy confirming squamous cell carcinoma of the cheek?
What is the most likely diagnosis for a female presenting with a mass involving the tail of the parotid gland that is irregular on palpation?
What diagnosis would be most likely for a patient presenting with weight loss, hoarseness, and an irregular mass on one vocal cord with no mobility?
A patient presents with a non-healing ulcer on the lateral border of the tongue. On examination, cervical lymph nodes are palpable. What is the gold-standard investigation in this patient?

answers.option: CT scan of head and neck

question: What is the cheapest method to assess mandibular involvement in a patient presenting with oral cavity carcinoma?
What emergency treatment would be most beneficial for an elderly, hypertensive patient who presented with nasal bleeding a few hours ago and has congested nasal mucosa upon examination?

answers.option: Pinch the nose and ice packs
Cold sponge with pinching the nose

question: A patient presented with a history of scant foul-smelling discharge from the ear. On examination, cholesteatoma is present, but there is no mass. What would be the likely diagnosis?

answers.option: Atticoantral chronic suppurative otitis media with cholesteatoma

question: In the color blindness called deuteranopia, which type of color cone is lost?
